decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Spirit creatures. By utilizing cards like Drogskol Captain and Reflector Mage, alongside mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Cards like Collected Company and Spell Queller provide additional versatility and control options, allowing the player to adapt to various scenarios. Overall, the deck seeks to establish dominance early in the game and maintain pressure throughout to secure a victory.

This deck is focused on aggressively filling up the graveyard and utilizing its resources for big explosive plays. The key concept centers around discarding cards from the hand with cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry, while also utilizing cards like Faithless Looting to dig through the deck. By discarding cards, it synergizes with cards like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Flameblade Adept to quickly put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes creatures with Delve, such as Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, to take advantage of the overflowing graveyard.

This deck is centered around the key card Krark-Clan Ironworks (KCI). The main goal of the deck is to generate mana and sac artifacts using KCI, allowing for explosive plays and creating a loop of recurring artifacts. The deck includes various artifacts and mana sources like Terrarion, Mox Opal, and Mind Stone to fuel the combo. It also utilizes cards like Ichor Wellspring and Scrap Trawler to generate card advantage and recover artifacts from the graveyard. The inclusion of Sai, Master Thopterist and Myr Retriever adds additional value and versatility to the deck.

This deck revolves around playing aggressively with the Death's Shadow creature, which grows stronger as your life total decreases. The deck is built to quickly put pressure on your opponent and disrupt their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. You also have access to powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, along with protection like Stubborn Denial. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible while controlling the board and disrupting your opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using spells like Manamorphose and Faithless Looting to bring out powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix. Utilizing cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot to control the board while setting up for big swings with Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice. With disruption spells like Thoughtseize and tempo plays with Izzet Charm, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control to secure the win in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo to generate infinite mana by sacrificing artifacts and then using this mana to repeatedly activate Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combination, creating an ever-growing army of flying Thopter tokens. The deck also includes various artifact cards to help dig for combo pieces, recur key cards from the graveyard, and control the board state. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of tokens.

This deck focuses on playing a fast and aggressive game with Spirit creatures. The key strategy involves using Mausoleum Wanderer and Supreme Phantom to boost the power of other Spirits, while utilizing Aether Vial and Collected Company to quickly get creatures onto the battlefield. Drogskol Captain provides protection for your Spirits, making them harder to deal with. Spell Queller and Reflector Mage help control the opponent's board, while Geist of Saint Traft provides a powerful finisher. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of evasive, powerful creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and summon powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. This is achieved by utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Simic Growth Chamber, and Selesnya Sanctuary to generate extra land drops and increase mana production. The deck also includes cards like Tolaria West and Trinket Mage to search for important combo pieces such as Summoner's Pact and Engineered Explosives. Overall, the goal is to efficiently ramp and search for key cards to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game.

The deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Primeval Titan. By utilizing cards like Trinket Mage and Tolaria West to search for key pieces like Gemstone Mine and Selesnya Sanctuary, the deck can quickly assemble a combo to bring out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan. The deck also includes control elements like Pact of Negation and Engineered Explosives to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Amulet of Vigor, Azusa, and Primeval Titan to cast powerful threats and set up game-winning combos. It utilizes land-bouncing effects like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands to generate excessive mana and gain extra land drops per turn. The deck also employs toolbox cards like Trinket Mage to search for key pieces like Engineered Explosives or Walking Ballista, while also including utility lands like Bojuka Bog for graveyard hate. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with massive threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and then bring back Arclight Phoenix to the battlefield for aggressive attacks. The deck aims to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and utilize cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to enable this strategy. Additionally, cards like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake provide additional threats to overwhelm the opponent, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Axe help to clear the way for the aggressive creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards to bring back Arclight Phoenixes and activate Thing in the Ice, while also maintaining card advantage and tempo with spells like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose. It aims to be aggressive and explosive, utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot to control the board and finish off opponents quickly. The deck also includes Crackling Drake for additional threats and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy for card advantage and graveyard manipulation. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost artifact creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, then using cards like Steel Overseer and Cranial Plating to boost their power. Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium serve as key threats that can quickly close out the game. Galvanic Blast provides reach and removal, while the deck's mana base allows for efficient casting of its spells. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive artifact creatures, backed up by powerful artifact synergies.

This deck focuses on assembling the powerful Amulet Titan combo by using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana, allowing the player to play multiple lands in a turn and ramp quickly into Primeval Titan. The deck also utilizes cards like Trinket Mage to tutor for important pieces of the combo, while also providing utility with cards like Walking Ballista and Engineered Explosives. The goal is to ramp into Primeval Titan as quickly as possible, fetch lands like Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion or Slayer's Stronghold for additional value, and overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures like Zacama, Primal Calamity and Hornet Queen.

This deck utilizes the powerful Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive combos and graveyard synergies. By milling cards from the deck and bringing back creatures from the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and finish them off quickly. The key strategy is to maximize graveyard interactions through cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Creeping Chill, while also utilizing cards like Conflagrate and Prized Amalgam to deal damage and pressure the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards using cards like Faithless Looting, Cathartic Reunion, and Shriekhorn. Once the graveyard is filled, the deck can utilize cards like Life from the Loam to bring back key cards like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam to create a strong board presence. Cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate can also be used to deal direct damage to the opponent while benefiting from cards being put into the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board state and graveyard interaction.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Creeping Chill, while using cards like Shriekhorn and Stinkweed Imp to dredge cards into your graveyard. This allows you to constantly bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast from the graveyard, creating a powerful board presence and overwhelming your opponent with constant threats. The ultimate goal is to set up a powerful combo turn that can quickly finish off your opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. It also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Serum Powder and Zhalfirin Void. The deck leverages Eldrazi Temple and other colorless lands to efficiently cast powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Matter Reshaper. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive Eldrazi aggro game plan.

This deck revolves around quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of powerful Human creatures, supported by cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage to control the opponent's plays. With the acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial, as well as the mana fixing from cards like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly playing out a team of aggressive human creatures, leveraging cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump them up. Cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to ensure that these creatures can be played and protected efficiently. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, synergistic team of human creatures while disrupting their plans.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on dominating the board with hard removal, countermagic, and card advantage. By using versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the game by efficiently answering threats and winning through incremental advantage. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta provide additional card advantage and inevitability, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix provide early game interaction and reach. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant late-game presence to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Krark-Clan Ironworks (KCI) alongside Scrap Trawler and various artifacts to generate a powerful combo that allows the player to generate a significant amount of mana and card advantage. The deck includes cards like Terrarion, Mind Stone, and Ichor Wellspring to help with the combo, while also including cards like Sai, Master Thopterist for additional value. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces (Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and various artifacts) to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage. By sacrificing and recurring artifacts, the deck can gain a significant advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and explosive combo. The deck focuses on using efficient mana sources and card draw to set up its combo pieces and protect them with cards like Defense Grid. Additionally, Sai, Master Thopterist provides additional value and win conditions through creating thopter tokens.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to efficiently generate mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while using cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The deck aims to draw through the deck quickly with Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions, finding key pieces like Gifts Ungiven and Grapeshot to ultimately win the game by casting a large storm count spell or creating a massive army of goblin tokens with Empty the Warrens. The deck relies on precise sequencing and careful planning to achieve victory.
